title: Emperor Jahangir and toleration of religions

content.description:
Image 1

MUGHAL EMPEROR JAHANGIR HOLDING A GLOBE, SOUTH ASIA, 1617

Courtesy of Sotheby’s Picture Library

Image 2

MUGHAL EMPEROR JAHANGIR HOLDING A PICTURE OF THE VIRGIN MARY, SOUTH ASIA, 1620

Jahangir holding a picture of the Madonna, inscribed in Persian: Jahangir Shah, Mughal, 1620 (detail of 57393) / National Museum of India, New Delhi, India / Bridgeman Images
content.question: The portrait of Emperor Jahangir in Image 2 is best seen as evidence of which of the following?

choices.label: The Mughals’ toleration of different religious traditions within their state
Indian artisans producing artistic works for export markets
The increased sponsorship of artists by new economic elites
Jahangir’s creation of a syncretic belief system incorporating Christianity and Islam

content.answer: The Mughals’ toleration of different religious traditions within their state
